questions.question: Before starting an investigation or lab procedure, you should...

choices.answer: try an experiment of your own
open all containers and packages
read all directions and make sure you understand them
handle all the equipment to become familiar with it
tell your teacher immediately
ind bandages or a first aid kit
go to the principals office
get help after you finish the lab

questions.question: If you get hurt or injured in any way, you should

choices.answer: use it only for solid materials
give it to your teacher for recycling or disposal
put it back into the storage cabinet
increase the damage so that it is obvious

questions.question: If your glassware is chipped or broken, you should
If you have unused chemicals after finishing a procedure, you should

choices.answer: pour them down a sink or drain
mix them all together in a bucket
put them back into their original containers
dispose of them as directed by your teacher
use your hand to bring fumes from the container to your nose
bring the container under your nose and inhale deeply
tell your teacher immediately
use odor-sensing equipment

questions.question: If you need to determine the odor of a chemical or a solution, you should
When working with materials that might fly into the air hurt someones eye, you should wear...

choices.answer: goggles
an apron
gloves
hat
door
windows
fire extinguisher
overhead lights

questions.question: Before doing experiments involving a heat source, you should know the location of the...

choices.answer: wash your hands immediately
put the lid back on the chemical container
wait to see if your eye becomes irritated
use the eyewash right away

questions.question: if you get a chemical in your eye, you should

choices.answer: tie back long hair or hair that hangs in front of your eyes
heat substances or objects inside a closed container
touch an object with your bare hand to see how hot it is
throw hot objects into the trash when you are done with them

questions.question: When working with a flame or heat source, you should
if a beaker of water falls to the floor and breaks, you should

choices.answer: continue working
carefully pick up and dispose of the glass
tell your teacher about the accident
mop up the water

questions.question: Which of the following is an important step in maintaining lab and personal hygiene?

choices.answer: wash your hands thoroughly before leaving the lab
notify your teacher immediately if glassware breaks
use tongs or protective gloves to handle heated objects
do not leave a hotplate unattended while it is switched on
call out for your teacher's and lab partner's attention
run to the safety shower as fast as you can
drop to the floor and roll over
cover your face with your hands

questions.question: Which of the following should you NOT do if your clothing catches fire
Which of the following would be called an unauthorized experiment?

choices.answer: using objects you collected during a field observation
you designed yourself with the approval of your teacher
one that includes procedures not approved by your teacher
one found in your lab manual text
animals are not permitted in the lab
science is a serious subject with no room for creativity
lab tools, if misused, can cause injury and it is expensive
free expression is not a part of science

questions.question: Why is horseplay not allowed in the lab?
Which of the following should always be carried out when working with hot plates/heating device

choices.answer: look out for a color change to show high temps of glassware
make sure they are switched off before leaving the lab
touch the surface to test the temps before leaving the lab
use a match to light a Bunsen burner
it gets very lonely working by yourself
if an accident happens, there is no one to turn to for help
teachers do not like students to pursue independent inquiry
science discourages the creativity of individuals

questions.question: Why should you never work alone in the lab?
